judges: Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Allocatur was improvidently granted, and the appeal is dismissed.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell and Mr. Justice Barbieri took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Simon B. John, Assistant Public Defender, with him Thomas P. Ruane, Jr., Public Defender, for appellant.
Gerald R. Solomon, Assistant District Attorney, and Joseph E. Kovach, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Sullivan, Appellant.
Argued November 12, 1971.
Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
Simon B. John, Assistant Public Defender, with him Thomas P. Ruane, Jr., Public Defender, for appellant.
Gerald R. Solomon, Assistant District Attorney, and Joseph E. Kovach, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
December 20, 1971:
